div.p: RapidContext is a JavaScript application server that makes creating dynamic web applications easier.

td.p: The quick tour shows the basics of RapidContext in an interactive fashion.

Pane.pageTitle: Welcome to the Quick Tour of RapidContext!

ul.li: In this tour you'll see some of the basic functionality in RapidContext.
The tour can be cancelled at any time by pressing the icon on this dialog.
The built-in Start app is normally launched directly on startup.
It provides convenient launchers for all available apps (that the user has permission to run).
It also provides an information area which can be configured by the installed plug-ins.
At the top right corner of the screen is the user and environment information.
Hovering over it with the mouse reveals the User Menu.
This menu provides quick launchers for the built-in apps.
This is the Help & Docs app.
Here you'll find the complete user manual for RapidContext.
It also contains all the developer documentation, including the MochiKit API:s.
Several apps can be run in parallel, each using a separate tab.
Switching and closing apps is easy using the tab control bar.
Multiple instances of a single app is also possible.
This is the Admin app.
Here you can monitor and change many aspects of RapidContext.
It also provides a number of development tools.
Server-side calls are executed with something called a procedure.
The Admin app makes it possible to view, edit and test all installed procedures.
Try executing the System.Session.Current for example!
All calls from the client to the server can be logged and traced.
The log level is dynamic and can be changed at any time.
Errors and warnings from the various apps also end up here.
The Admin app also makes it easy to add or modify users.
New users can be created by the icon.
Permissions are controlled by the roles that a user has (role "Admin" gives full access).
New functionality can easily be added by installing new or updated plug-ins.
A plug-in can provide any type of functionality, from apps via default configuration to connectivity API:s.
It is also possible to unload plug-ins to disable them without removing them completely.
